quiz.text: An alloy of copper and zinc is taken in the ratio 1 : 2, and another alloy of the same metal is taken in the ratio of 2 : 3. How many parts of the two alloys must be taken to obtain a new alloy consisting of copper and zinc that are in the ratio 3 : 5?
options: 7 and 9
5 and 7
3 and 5
5 and 3
None of these

quiz.text: In two alloys, gold and silver are in the ratios of 4 : 1 and 1 : 3. After alloying together 10 kg of the first alloy, 16 kg of the second and several kilograms of pure gold, an alloy was obtained in which the ratio of gold to silver was 3 : 2. Find the weight of the new alloy ?
options: 12 kg.
19 kg.
24 kg.
35 kg.
None of these

quiz.text: Rs. 5625 are divided among A, B and C so that A received half as much as B and C together and B received one fourth as much as A and C together. Find the sum of A’s and B’s share together?
options: Rs. 2500
Rs. 3000
Rs. 1500
Rs. 4000
None of these

quiz.text: A man spends Rs. 2310 on an average during the first 8 month from the income. During next 4 months he spends Rs. 1800 on an average from his income but he had taken a loan of Rs. 1680 apart from his income to meet his both ends. If he spent all what he had then the ratio of average income and average expenditure?
options: 50 : 53
100 : 103
100 : 109
100 : 107
None of these

quiz.text: In a family the ratio of expenses to the savings is 5 : 3. But his expenses is increased by 60% and income is increased by only 25% thus there is decrease of Rs. 3500 in the saving. Find the increased income of the family?
options: Rs. 35000
Rs. 28000
Rs. 25000
Rs. 18,500
None of these

quiz.text: Arti has coins of the denomination of Rs. 1, 50 paise and 25 paise in the ratio of 12 : 10 : 7. The total worth of the coins she has is Rs. 75. Find the number of 25 paise coins ?
options: 28
36
42
32
None of these

quiz.text: Two horses cost as much as 5 dogs, 6 dogs as much as 8 oxen, 10 oxen as much as 50 sheep, 14 sheep as much as 9 goats. If the price of one goat is Rs. 700, find the cost of one horse ?
options: Rs. 7900
Rs. 6400
Rs. 5200
Rs. 4800
None of these

quiz.text: Rs. 2186 is distributed among A, B and C. If money given to them is decreased by Rs. 26, Rs. 28 and Rs. 32 respectively, then the ratio of their share become 9 : 13 : 8. What is the amount given to A ?
options: Rs. 696
Rs. 626
Rs. 656
Rs. 956
None of these

quiz.text: Sample ore contains 20% of an alloy that has 85% iron. Other than this, in the remaining 80% of the ore, there is no iron. What is the quantity of ore (in kg) needed to obtain 60 kg of pure iron? (up to two decimal points)
options: 366  kg
352.94 kg
267 kg
267  kg
366.58 kg

quiz.text: A year ago, the cost of Maruti and Figo are in the ratio of 3 : 4. The ratio of present and past year costs of Maruti and Figo are 5 : 4 and 3 : 2. If the sum of their present cost is 7.8 lacs. Find the cost of Figo a year ago?
options: 3.2 lac
1.6 lac
3.5 lac
4.0 lac
None of these

quiz.text: One year ago, the ratio between Ram’s and Shyam’s salaries was 3 : 5. The ratio of their individual salaries of last year and present year are 2 : 3 and 4 : 5 respectively. If their total salaries for the present year is Rs. 8600, find the present salary of Ram ?
options: 3200
3600
4000
4400
None of these

quiz.text: Two candles of the same height are lighted at the same time. The first is consumed in 8 hours and the second in 6 hours. Assuming that each candle burns at a constant rate, in how many hours after being lighted, the ratio between the first and second candles becomes 2 : 1?
options: 4 h
5 h
4 h 30 m
4 h 48m
None of these

quiz.text: The total of daily wages of Ram, Shyam, and Mohan is Rs. 450. If they, respectively spend 25%, 20%, and 50% of their incomes then the ratio of their savings becomes 9: 8: 4. What is the income of Ram?
options: 180
190
200
175
None of these

quiz.text: There is 1000 litres milk in a pot. 100 litres of milk is taken out and same amount of water is poured into it. Again 200 litres of mixture is taken out and same amount of water is poured into it and finally 400 litres of mixture is taken out and same amount of water is poured into it then what is the amount of milk in the resulting mixture?
options: 432
436
425
438
None of these

quiz.text: On entire Earth the ratio between land and water is 1 : 2 and at northern hemisphere this ratio is 2 : 3. What will be the ratio of land with water at southern hemisphere?
options: 11 : 4
4 : 11
15 : 4
4 : 15
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of the incomes of A, B and C is 3 : 7 : 4 and the ratio of their expenditures is 4 : 3 : 5. If in the income of Rs. 2400, A saves Rs. 300 then the savings of B and C is respectively are
options: Rs. 4025 and Rs. 575
Rs. 1575 and 2625
Rs. 2750 and Rs. 1025
Rs. 3725 and Rs. 1525
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of wine and water in a drum is 3 : 1. What part of the mixture is taken out and same amount of water is added to it so that the ratio of wine and water in the mixture become 1 : 1?
options: 3/1
1/3
3/4
2/3
None of these

quiz.text: In a mixture of petrol and kerosene, petrol is only 99 litres. If this same quantity of petrol would be presented in another mixture of petrol and kerosene where total volume would be 198 litres less than the actual mixture then the concentration of petrol in the actual mixture would have been 13.33% less than that of the new mixture. What is the concentration of petrol in actual mixture?
options: 20%
16.66%
26.66%
8.33%
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio of age between A and B is 6 : 5 and the age of each C and D is  times that of B. Age of F is less than A but greater than B. The ratio of ages between B and E is 2 : 3. Also age of A is 3 years less than E. What is the ratio of ages of A and F if all the ages are in integers?
options: 12 : 11
9 : 7
24 : 19
12 : 13
None of these

quiz.text: Three vessels having volumes in the ratio of 2 : 3: 5 are full of a mixture of water and milk. In the first vessel ratio of water and milk is 1 : 3, in the second 2 : 3 and in the third vessel, 2: 5. If all the three vessels were poured out in a large container, what is the resulting ratio of milk and water?
options: 43 : 96
438 : 962
348 : 962
481 : 219
None of these

quiz.text: 10 yr before, the ratio of ages of A and B was 13 : 17. After 17 yr from now, the ratio of their ages will be 10 : 11. The present age B is
options: 23 yr
40 yr
27 yr
44 yr
None of these

quiz.text: Age of P and R are added to twice the age of Q, the total becomes 59. It the ages of Q and R are added to thrice the age of P, the total become 68. And if the age of P is added to thrice the age of Q and thrice age of R, the total becomes 108, what is the total of ages of P, Q and R?
options: 45 years
47 years
49 years
42 years
None of these

quiz.text: During our campaign against child labour we have found that in three glass making factories A, B and C there were total 33 children aged below 18 were involved. The ratio of boys to girls in A, B and C was 4 : 3, 3 : 2 and 5 : 4 respectively. If the no. of girls working in the factories B and C be equal then find the no. of girls working in factory A :
options: 5
2
8
6
None of these

quiz.text: Milk and water are mixed in vessel A in the ratio of 5:2 and in vessel B in the ratio of 8 : 5. In what ratio should quantities be taken from the two vessels so as to form a mixture in which milk and water will be in the ratio of 9 : 4?
options: 7 : 2
5 : 2
2 : 7
2 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: A bag contains 10-paise and 25-paise coins in the ratio of 17 : 6. If the total money in the bag is Rs. 112, the number of 10-paise coins is
options: 35
210
490
595
None of these

quiz.text: A vessel of 120 litres is filled with milk and water. 80% of milk and 40% of water is taken out of the vessel. It is found that the vessel is vacated by 65%. What is the ratio of milk to water?
options: 5 : 3
6 : 5
3 : 5
4 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: A bag contains one-rupee, 50 paise and 25 paise coins in the ratio 5 : 6 : 8. If the total amount of money in the bag is Rs. 210. Find the number of coins of each kind.
options: 105, 126, 168
104, 136, 176
106, 116, 156
108, 126, 146
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of Rs. 76 is divided among A, B and C in such a way that A gets Rs. 7 more than what B gets and B gets Rs. 6 more than what C gets. The ratio of their share is :
options: 19 : 24 : 33
32 : 25 : 19
32 : 24 : 20
19 : 25 : 33
None of these

quiz.text: A man gave 50% of his savings of Rs. 168200 to his wife and divided the remaining sum among his  sons Aakash and Bahadur of 15 and 13 years of age respectively. He divided it in such a way that each of his sons when they attain the age of 18 years, would receive the same amount, if interest rate is 5% compound interest per annum. The share of Bahadur was
options: Rs. 42050
Rs. 40000
Rs. 45000
Rs. 45500
None of these

quiz.text: In a mixture of milk and water of Volume 30 Litre the ratio of water and milk is 3 : 7. How much quantity of water will be added to the mixture to make the ratio of milk and water 1 : 2?
options: 23 Litre
21 Litre
12 Litre
33 Litre
None of these

quiz.text: If in Textile department, the present age of female employee is 70% of the age of Male employee 4 years hence and difference between the present age of the female employee and Transgender employee is one fourth of the present age of female employee. What is the average age of all the employees in textile department if Transgender employee is older person in that department?
options: 27 years
37 years
30 years
33 years
31 years

quiz.text: If the difference between the ages of the Male employee and Transgender employee in Education department was 12 years and that of ratio is 3:4 and the average age of the same department after 5 years is 42 years, then find the present age of the female employee.
options: 16 years
27 years
21 years
32 years
35 years

quiz.text: If average age of all the employees in Finance department in 2007 was 39 (1/3) then what will be the ratio of their ages in 2010? (Given that the female employee who used to work in 2007 had quit and a new female employee works in the department in 2010)
options: 41:37:40
40:17:50
50:30:41
55:37:41
50:37:40

quiz.text: The age of female employee in the Defence department is the average age of male employee and Transgender employee of that department. Then the age of female employee is what percent of total age of all employees in the same department.
options: 35(1/3)%
31(1/3)%
33(1/3)%
41(1/3)%
37(1/3)%

quiz.text: Age of Transgender employee in commerce department is 85% of the present age of Transgender employee of the Finance department and the age of female employee in commerce department after 32 years is 2 times the present age of the Transgender employee in commerce department. Find what percent the present age of female employee is of the average age of the all employees in the same department after 4 years.
options: 72.62%
81.81%
73.88%
92.53%
98.35%

quiz.text: What is the ratio of number of female employee from Technical department to number of employees under age of 40 from HR department?
options: 5:3
3:5
2:3
1:2
1:3

quiz.text: If the number of females in marketing department is 30, then find the number of employees whose age is more than 40 years in same department.
options: 129
195
168
157
182

quiz.text: What is the difference between Total employees in Coordination department and female employees in HR department if 10% of total employees are in Marketing department?
options: 480
517
289
172
162

quiz.text: If in coordination department, there are no employees under 40 years, then by what percent number of employee under the age of 40 in Administration are more than the total number of employees in marketing department if 10% of total employees are in the Marketing department?
options: 168%
112%
125%
179%
105%

quiz.text: If in Administration department 35% females are under the age of 40, then what is the ratio of number of females who are above 40 to the number of males who are under the age of 40 in the same department (Let in coordination department, there are no employees under 40 years)?
options: 112:119
118:113
117:219
135:116
None of these

quiz.text: If the number of people who are more than 50 years of age cast their votes from Goa, are 0.5 times the total number of people who are less than 51 years of age cast their votes from Uttarakhand, then total number of people who cast their votes from Goa in all age groups is what percent of the total number of people who cast their votes from Uttarakhand in all age groups?
options: 170%
190%
210%
150%
None of these

quiz.text: If the number of people who cast their votes from U.P. in the age group of (51-70) years are 36 lakhs and the number of people who cast their votes in the age group of (18-25) years from Punjab are 100 lakh then find the ratio of the number of people who cast their votes from UP in age group (18-25) years to the total number of people who are more than 35 years of age cast their votes from Punjab.
options: 126 : 95
85 : 126
125 : 13
13 : 126
None of these

quiz.text: If the total number of people who cast their votes from Punjab is 425 lakhs then number of people of more than 35 years of age who cast their votes from Punjab is what percent more/less than the total number of people of age less than 36 years who cast their votes from Punjab? (Calculate up to two decimal points)
options: 47.24%
43.53%
44.28%
45.16%
38.70%

quiz.text: If the number of people who cast their votes from Manipur in the age group of 18-25 are 10.5 lakh and the no. of people who cast their votes from Goa in the age group of 51-70 are 30% more than the total number of people who cast their votes from Manipur, then find the approximate total number of people who cast their votes from Goa in all age groups?
options: 350 lakh
288 lakh
342 lakh
338 lakh
400 lakh

quiz.text: Out of the total number of people who cast their votes from UP, 55% of them are female then find the number of female who cast their votes from UP in the age group of (71-100) if total number of people who cast their votes from UP are 300 lakh?
options: 75 lakhs
85 lakhs
95 lakhs
Cannot be determined
None of these

quiz.text:
A sum of money Rs 2550 is to be distributed among Krishna, Vijay, and Ramaswami. What will be your share of Vijay?

A. Krishna’s share is 1.5 times Vijay’s share,

B. Ramaswami’s share is half the share of Krishna and Vijay together.

C. The share of Krishna is Rs 340 more than Vijay.
options: Either A and B together or A and C together are sufficient
Only A and B together are sufficient
Only A and C together are sufficient
All statements are required
Any 2 of the 3 statements are sufficient

quiz.text:
What is the total number of coins in a bag containing only 50-paise and one-rupee coins?

A. Total number of coins in the bag is equal to twice the number of 50-paise coins.

B. If the number of 50-paise coins decreased by 50%, the bag would have Rs 62.50.

C. If the number of one-rupee coins is decreased by 20%, the bag will have Rs 65.
options: A and either B or C
Any two of the 3 statements
Any 1 of the 3 statements
Only A and B together
All statements are required ‘

quiz.text:
The money is to be distributed among P, Q and R. What will be R’s share in it?

A. The difference between R’s and Q’s share is Rs 100.

B. P’s share is Rs 270.

C. The ratio of the shares of Q and R is 3 : 7.
options: Only A
A and C together
All are not sufficient
All are required
None of these

quiz.text:
What is the population of the city A?

I. The ratio of the population of males and females in city A is 27 : 23 and the difference between their population is 100000.

II. The population of city A is 80% of that of city B. The difference between populations of city A and city B is 312500.
options: Both I and II together are not sufficient
Both I and II together are needed.
Only I alone is sufficient.
Only II alone is sufficient.
Either I or II alone is sufficient

quiz.text:
How many students did participate in elocution?

I. The students who participated in dancing were 150% more than that who participated in elocution.

II. 150 students participated in dancing.
options: Both I and II together are not sufficient
Both I and II together are needed.
Only I alone is sufficient.
Only II alone is sufficient.
Either I or II alone is sufficient

quiz.text: ____ litres of mixture of milk and water contains milk and water in the ratio of 3 : 2. The ____ liters of water should be added to the mixture to get 45 % milk on it. Which of the following options satisfies the given condition? I) 75, 25 II) 90, 30 III) 100, 24
options: Both I and II
Only II
Both II and III
Only III
Only I

quiz.text: The ratio of wine and water in a mixture is 16:13 respectively. One man added 16 litres of wine and 8 litres of water to the mixture and hence the ratio became 4:3 respectively. 60% of the mixture is used at a party. Another man added 20 litres of wine and 10 litres of water to the remaining mixture. Find the difference between the quantities of wine and water in the final mixture.
options: 12 litres
14 litres
20 litres
18 litres
None of these

quiz.text: A’s present age is six years less than B’s age after nine years. The ratio of present age of B and C is 5:9. C is 21 years younger than D and D is three years older than E. Square of the E’s present age is 1350 more than 15 times of E’s present age? Quantity I: What is the difference between A’s present age and E’s age after 16 years? Quantity II: After 6 years F’s age is twice that of A’s present age. G’s present age is 3.5 times of 25% of sum of present age of F and A. What is the present age of G?  Quantity III: Twice of A’s present age is eight years more than that of H’s present age, then find the H’s present age?
options: >, >
<, <
>, <
≥, <
<, ≤
